holidays.name: National Limerick Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the witty and often humorous five-line limerick poem with its distinct rhythm and rhyme scheme.
holidays.origin: Observed on the birthday of Edward Lear, the 19th-century English artist and poet who popularized the limerick form.
holidays.funFact: Edward Lear wrote hundreds of limericks, many nonsensical, which helped make the form a staple of children's poetry.

holidays.name: National Nutty Fudge Day
holidays.description: A sweet day dedicated to enjoying fudge loaded with crunchy nuts for the perfect balance of smooth and crunch.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday created to honor this popular candy treat and encourage indulgence.
holidays.funFact: Fudge originated in the late 1800s, and adding nuts became a favorite variation that boosts both texture and flavor.

holidays.name: Zebra Day
holidays.description: A quirky day to appreciate the striking patterns and mysterious nature of zebras, symbols of uniqueness and individuality.
holidays.origin: Created to raise awareness about the challenges zebras face in the wild and to celebrate their distinctive stripes.
holidays.funFact: Each zebra's stripe pattern is as unique as a human fingerprint ‚Äî no two zebras have the same pattern!

holidays.origin: An informal observance that plays on the common nervous habit and turns it into a lighthearted activity.
holidays.funFact: Twiddling your thumbs can actually help improve focus and motor skills when done mindfully.
